metadata.title: CVE-2022-44792 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
handle_ipDefaultTTL in agent/mibgroup/ip-mib/ip_scalars.c in Net-SNMP 5.8through 5.9.3 has a NULL Pointer Exception bug that can be used by a remoteattacker (who has write access) to cause the instance to crash via acrafted UDP packet, resulting in Denial of Service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-44792` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsnmp-base - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.3+esm3
libsnmp-perl - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.3+esm3
libsnmp30 - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.3+esm3
python-netsnmp - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.3+esm3
snmp - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.3+esm3
snmpd - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.3+esm3
tkmib - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.3+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: net-snmp package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.3+esm3').
